one of two beat 'em ups that I think stand out amongst them all, Charlie Murder is a game that knows itself too well and follows through on exactly what it wants to be. a gorey brawler oozing with personality from the music, plot, characters and even just the in-game tattoo stores, it strikes all the right notes a well-paced beat 'em up should for an excellent multiplayer experience. 36269731.review:
This isn't a bad game. It's just not a very cohesively designed one.

It's a beat-em-up, which is a genre that's very easy to do well if you just stick to the formula, but Charlie Murder tries to break that formula as often as it can and the resulting gamefeel is really inconsistent.

For example, there are empty sections in most levels. There is at least one very long, very empty backtrack. There is precision platforming (oh my god why). There are shops that you have to diverge from the main route to get to, meaning your party had better be exceptionally good at following the leader and the leader had better be exceptionally good at asking whether anyone needs shopping. There is a cellphone picture minigame in which you steer a massively zoomed in little window around like a tugboat and try to take a picture of an object within a one foot range of you to see if it might spawn an item into your inventory. There are long, atmospheric, but ultimately boring cutscenes.

On the other hand, there is a punk guitar-hero recurring minigame that feels perfectly dope (and actually pretty challenging) to play. There is a really consistent aesthetic throughout with some nice little flourishes in certain sections. The beat-em-up parts feel reasonable, and picking new perks every couple of levels makes for some interesting build diversification. You get specials often and they feel mostly good to use.

At its best, Charlie Murder feels like Castle Crashers. At its worst, it feels like an incoherent mess. In between, there's the plot and the atmosphere and the pacing, which all feel like they'd be better at home in something like Salt & Sanctuary (where the moodiness and slow unfurling of the story work perfectly).

If you've got a really cooperative group of friends who all like beat-em-ups, this is a reasonable buy on sale. 

It's not Castle Crashers. It won't make you remember everything you love about the genre. But its high points and its low ones average out to a sort of middling experience.

On the other hand, if you're planning to play solo, you don't objectively love beat-em-ups, and you don't have a cooperative group of friends, give this one a miss.

34559593.review:
5/10

Charlie Murder is a neat, side-scrolling beat 'em up with a cool aesthetic. The graphical style is unique, and the dark and moody levels are quite inspired. You play as a member of the band, Charlie Murder. I played the bassist (called the Shaman in game) and my co-op partner played the vocalist (called the Berzerker in game). You gain powers by getting tattoos in a tattoo parlor, and your collectibles are QR codes that you find and can take pictures of with your in-game phone. As you progress in the game, you gain "followers" and can upgrade your stats and acquire abilities. 

During most of the game you're throwing combos at different types of macabre enemies, using weapons and powers whenever possible. My favorite weapon was one of the giant axes or hammers, which delay on the swing and then offer a powerful and satisfying crunch. As the shaman, my favorite powers were an "earthquake" which created a zone of lava that did burning damage, and a cloud that I could summon that would hit enemies with lightning and acid rain. The game can get somewhat challenging towards the end, and kept us engaged.

However, the connection issues in this game are absolutely awful. The one thing I can praise is that it was easy to get my partner in the game, and he was never booted for any reason. Whenever a character goes down, the other character can perform a CPR/revival maneuver to pick them back up. Nailing the button presses, this only worked for me perhaps once out of the ten times or so I needed to revive my partner. I'm not sure if this was due to me using an XBOX 360 controller, but it was absolutely a pain. Additionally, if I quit to the world map when this didn't work, my partner would remain dead and not show up on the screen. However, sometimes if I continued to advance through a level afterwards he would appear beside me. On a few occasions, my co-op partner was looking at an entirely different screen than what was visible to me, the host. Once, I had to tell him to move forward when his character was beside me, though he was staring at a loading screen on his end. The icing on this buggy cake was the final boss fight. I'm not sure if my co-op partner was supposed to be able to move during the final cutscene, but he moved forward and punched the boss during the exposition. When the boss battle began, the boss was trapped off of the screen on the right side. We just kept using attacks until we heard noises indicating success and saw the credits roll.

So, hopefully this game is much more stable in single-player. However, I bought it due to the online co-op feature, so it was a bit disappointing for me. It's a shame, because outside of the connection issues, I think the developer created something pretty special.

34029249.review:
Charlie Murder is a game about kicking ass and not necessarily taking names. You play as one of the members of the titular band, and then kill things. Then you kinda never stop from there on out.

I won't lie; this game is all about Charlie murdering (heh) his way through the zombie apocalypse. It's an adrenaline rush all the way through with no stops. Trust me when I say you go off the rails on this crazy train.

Anyway, the game kicks off with Charlie and company screaming into microphones as they plummet into Hell. Then they beat the shit out of some demons. This is all you get as a tutorial. It's all you need.

After the game decides you've figured out how to break various parts of people's bodies, you get lifted back to Earth as some paramedics kickstart your heart. After this, it's just blood, guts, punk rock, and beating the everliving shit out of anything that isn't a merchant or someone you're playing the game with.

Stop reading here if you don't want to see the story.

This whole ordeal started with Charlie and his friends sitting around when he starts writing a song out of nowhere. Then some other stuff happens when he and his friend Phil go their separate ways. Phil gets angry and thinks Charlie betrayed him, while the latter doesn't have any fucks to give.

Phil tries to be some kind of guitar hipster and goes indie for a while, but then he gets pissy again and goes to a church, where he grabs a scythe and becomes- no, seriously; Lord Mortimer. He then forms a metal band with some lady that looks like Raven from Teen Titans, a generic Norwegian, and a fat Satan. Then they go murder Charlie Murder, and the game begins.

Yes, I realize how redundant that sentence is. Shut up.

Punk's not dead, ladies and gentlemen.

No, it came back from Hell to kick ass.

33813428.review:
Ska Studios c первой игры (которой для меня была Salt and Sanctuary) попала в список моих любимых инди разработчиков.
Их игры выполнены в узнаваемом стиле, с отличными саунтреками, явными и не очень отсылками к другим произвидениям игропрома, шикарным геймплеем, минииграми, сюжетом и вообще всем, чего можно пожелать от игры.
В  Charlie Murder вы играете за одного из участников одноименной панк-рок группы, на которых совершила покушение конкурирующая дет-метал группа [spoiler]собственно взаимоотношениям между лидерами команд и посвящен сюжет игры[/spoiler].
На самом деле, изначально я был настроен довольно скептически, пусть и Salt and Sanctuary от этой студии мне очень понравилась. Нас встречает довольно заурядный Beat 'em up, но как только я победил первого босса и дошел до ритм игры я расчувствовался и перестал жалеть о потраченных деньгах. Далее наколка татух, прокачка пары персов до 10 лвла, вечерок в компании с другом за одним комтьютером, встреча с отсылками на продукты игростроя и массовой культуры  [spoiler]от Resident Evil с ее большими монстрами и подсвеченными слабыми местами, до "из окна гостиничного номера своего, я телевизор выкинул на авто"[/spoiler] и тут такого просто куча.
Итак о плюсах:
+Незамысловатый, но интересный и даже драматичный сюжет
+Веселый геймплей
+Визуальный стиль и общая атмосфера игры
+Реиграбельность (за счет разных персонажей, сложностей и пары концовок)
+Кооп локальный (рекомендую засесть с друзьями в одной квартире) и сетевой
+Музыка
+Локализация присутствует
+-РПГ элементы (для меня это плюс, кому то может не понравиться)

Итог: эта игра не оставит вас равнодушным, даже если вы не фанат Beat 'em up'ов,  она стоит каждого рубля, который за нее просят и даже больше.

32005720.review:
If you thought RCRU was a disappointment, Charlie Murder might be up your alley.

CM is an arcade beat-em-up married to a Diablo loot and stat grind. A lot of beat-em-up stand bys are well represented here: weapons, grapple/throws, environmental hazards, the sort of classic arcade mechanics that stuff like Castle Crashers largely ignored. Here, you have about five different team members each with unique abilities, spells, and play style. Unfortunately, the combat remains a bit on the simple side, with only one character having anything resembling a cancel.

Online co-op is available, but I have not tried it. My memories from the 360 version involved a lot of griefing and a lot of mismatched levels. Since stats and gear are so important, you really need to be playing with friends with similar progression to have a coop experience that isn't one sided. And since friendly fire is on by default, griefing is incredibly easy.

I am thankful we got this and Dishwasher on PC, as it is nice to see how the developers advanced along both games to Salt & Sanctuary.

This is one of the best beat em ups ever. Like Castle Crashers... but way more in depth. Just gonna list off a few of the best and coolest features

Has 5 different characters, each fulfilling a different class. Each character can be upgraded and specced to fill other roles.
At least 3 unlockable special classes for each character.
Tons of violence, tons of weapons, tons of fatality type moves.
Lots of magic (tattoos in this game), each class and character has mainly unique spells, some spill over.
Great graphics and great music (And I don't even like rock and roll, I'm a hip hop fan, but this rock kicks ass)
There's a splash of guitar hero thrown in here and there. It's especially fun when you have a 4 man group and everyone has to hit their notes.
Tons of different team up attacks, unique depending on which character initiated it.
Explosives, pistols, shotguns, machine guns, axes, knives, pool cues, the list goes on and on.
Cross platform multiplayer.
Local multiplayer.
Has NG+ NG++ and NG+++, maybe more, never got that far.

Overall this is the perfect beat 'em up. I didn't even mention all the secret items, zones and shops, let alone secret bosses, flying shmup sequences. It's a must have for any Streets of Rage fan. HIghly recommend.

31812864.review:
Charlie Murder is one of the better beat'em ups out there. It's set over a post apocalyptic theme, with punk and death metal undertones. You've got level progression with different characters to choose from, special moves (anarchi), armor/clothing (and shops where you can buy that stuff!), lots of gore, a nifty soundtrack, fluid combat with combos and all sorts of weapons (pick up and throw an enemies decapitated head!), an in-game cellphone where you can take pics of certain items that unlocks stuff, and the game also has a few other things I'm sure I'm forgetting about...

This game was a day one purchase for me on the 360 and here on Steam as well. I like beat'em ups and usually games that have RPG elements (equipables, level progression, unlockables) so this game is right up my alley. My only con is the difficulty, it's a bit on the easy side for me, but that may be because I have already played it a lot on the 360. 

If you like beat'em ups, especially of the Castle Crasheresque nature, then CM is a must buy, seriously, for the price, and what you get, you will at the very least "like it". If you're not into beat'em ups, than I cannot recommend, even though it's more than most standard beat'em ups, it's still just a beat'em up at it's core. I still like CM a lot, but I it's not a game where I have spent a lot of time on. Expect a 10-20 hr max shelf life, which is longer than most in the genre.

横版过关，类似城堡破坏者，不过好玩很多倍。5个角色最多四人联机。角色有装备系统，武器，帽子，衣服，饰品，纹身，都有贴图区别（属性也类似暗黑随机的，种类还不少）。还有消耗品，宠物（不过是用来吃的，你没看错，就是用来吃！），还有各种环境物品可以拿来攻击。
游戏故事设定非常魔性，讲述一个被基友抛弃的屌丝变身大魔头，弄的满世界僵尸，之后基友拯救世界（吊打屌丝），顺带网络直播打僵尸涨粉（这才是主要目的？）的故事。
游戏里充满各种细节，比如僵尸会吃其他僵尸被打爆出来的脑子回血，各种环境物品比如砍刀每打一下上面的血就增加一点。酸性杀死的（你没看错，这游戏还有属性伤害！）僵尸肉身融化等等。还有很多细节不剧透了，自己体会。
最后说说我觉得最魔性的地方，就是打怪的经验值是你的粉丝数！你要是打的帅，比如花式吊打，连续击杀，终结技，打boss，那就是各种666咸鱼看你直播，粉丝数蹭蹭往上涨！而且粉丝还会给你留言，实在太cult了！

If you've played the Xbox 360 version of this game, you know how good it is. If you haven't, then buy it soon. It's a beat 'em up in the vein of Castle Crashers and Scott Pilgrim Vs The World The Game. You play as the punk rock band Charlie Murder, on their quest to defeat a mysterious villain (who's identity is eventually revealed). If you don't like gore, then you probably wouldn't enjoy this game, same goes for if you don't like the punk rock aesthetic. I highly recommend this game, it also has local and online co-op, as well as harder game modes unlocked after completing the game (like true vault hunter mode in borderlands 2). If you're not sure about it, get it on a sale.

P.S. Probably only get it if you have a controller, although you can bind keys on your keyboard, playing with a controller is best. Also you can use a PS4 controller by plugging it into your mac or pc using its USB charging cord that comes packaged with it.

31717652.review:
When it first came out it was one of the very few beat'em ups to have netplay from the start and it was pretty good netplay.

While the netplay now is a bit of a wild card on PC, with the game occasionally crashing when you try to join a game you're invited to, or being teleported to weird areas.  Ska Studios has put in at least 3 updates for the netplay TODAY, the day it came out, so you know you can depend on the company to have things fixed soon.

Other than that, this is one of the best beat'em ups out there, with tons of different clothing to alter your stats and tattoos to give you special abilities, also has a simple combo system to keep things interesting.

All in all 8/10 beat'em up that'll be a 10/10 once the netplay is completely fixed.

31717444.review:
Charlie Murder é um jogo RPG que lançou em 2013 pra Xbox 360. O jogo é tão bom que fiz questão de recomprar.
O jogo conta a história de 2 bandas rivais, uma banda de humanos e outra de dêmonios.  A banda dos humanos "Charlie Murder" e a dos dêmonios "Gore Quaffer". 
A lore do jogo é mais complexa, mas contar mais detalhes estragaria a experiência.

Os prós sobre o jogo:
-São apresenta 5 personagens jogáveis, com 4 variações de sua skin e suas skills.
-O jogo tem 3 dificuldades Normal, Caos e Anarquia, desbloqueadas após você zerar pela primeira vez.
-Tem modo Local, mas também Multiplayer, tanto privado como também público com o máximo de 4 jogadores.
-Há diversos Bosses e Mini-Bosses, que são necessários para os finais do jogo.
-O jogo contém 2 finais, o final Ruim, apenas matando os bosses, e o final Bom, matando todos os Bosses e Mini-Bosses juntamente com seu Loot dropado.
-Contém uma "Árvore de Habilidades" e distribuição de pontos em Status, como Força, Velocidade, Defesa e Magia.

Agora os contras sobre o jogo:
Como o jogo lançou dia 12/05(ontem no meu caso), ainda pode vir patches para corrigir alguns bugs. Mas vou citar alguns aqui:
-O sistema de Multiplayer é definido pela internet do Host, então as vezes pode acontecer de ocorrer algum lag.
-Também no sistema de multiplayer, existe um bug que você não consegue reviver seu aliado. O que deixa o jogo mais dficíl ainda, só revivendo o aliado ao trocar de área.
-Os controles no teclado não são totalmente explicados, então você pode ficar um pouco perdido. 

Mas em geral o jogo é excelente, tem uma trilha-sonora de rock boa e você fica jogando e rejogando para deixar todos os bonecos no máximo e testar todas as dificuldades, ou seja, rende boas horas de jogo. Jogar com amigos é ainda mais divertido, a dificuldade vai aumentando conforme o número de Players.
Realmente vale a pena comprar, os erros não sao tão cruciais, então eu diria que é um jogo nota 90/100.

31717278.review:
This is the game you need buddy

Pros:
-Good punk/ska/beatemup soundtrack
-Beautifully hand drawn artstyle   (caution is purposely muddy and scratchy!)
-Large sum of content ( 2 extra hard difficulty levels, inbetween 15 characters to unlock, your own apartment, tons gear )
-Diverse combat options ( you can electrocute enemies on electrical lines, mount them on iron spikes, smash them into the ground, eat their hearts <3, you can use katanas, shotguns, long candlesticks, and your voice to completely obliterate enemies )
-LOOT ( self explanatory with rpg elements that allow you to level up and unlock new abilties to disintegrate enemies and aid your friends! )
-Good Port ( some bugs, all content is here )
-Simple yet charming story ( yeah )

Cons:
-Wonky controls ( you may need to rebind the keys on-start so you can play properly    or use a gamepad   but preferably I use keyboard )
-New game bugs ( this game was ported well but there seems to be little things here and there, you'll live though :]  )

Overall:

Charlie murder is a fantastic game that orginally was ported from xbox360 arcade, it is a blast to run around with your friends blasting zombies, demons, gargantuan beasts into bits. The story is remarkably simple yet very captivating and you cant help but fall in love with and choose favorite characters! Honestly this is a steal at  $ 9.99. You have two buttons so quick attacks and heavy attacks and you can combine various combinations to uppercut enemies, smash them in the ground, you can also parry and shoot guns. On top of this you level up and unlock new abilities and find relics ( small trinkets think like binding of issac, that change you stats slightly and give you bonuses ) There is segments of the game where you do mini puzzles and little guitar hero parts that are different based on what character you play as. In a game I have never seen such a satisfying ending ever, trust me when I say the good ending and bad endings will make you emotional .

31715022.review:
Charlie Murder Review. 
Charlie murder is a XBLA game ported to steam with a few tweaks and more options. Charlie murder is a punk themed 4 player coop beat em up brawler. It is a very gory game with a dark story.
1  The game is a excellent port from XBLA to steam. Not much is different from the xbox 360 version other than more options, like rebindable keys, resolution options and video settings. The game still has 4 player local multipalyer it feels as good if not better than the xbox port as I have beaten that on the highest difficulty before years ago. 

2  The gameplay is excellent, if you have never played a SKA game before it is hard to describe but it plays like a RPG style brawler like Scott pilgrim saves the world and castle crashers but it has guns, throwable items, melee weapons and explosives. You also have abilities with cooldowns, this game is great fun with friends and has challenge but if you go around collecting the best stat items, maxing your level in every way getting all the best items it is really easy but it has 3 difficulties of challenge. If you know how to build up a easy multipilyer it does not take very long to level up your characters and since there are a total of 20 characters 5 and 3 reskins of each ice, Goth and horror I think that is a good thing that it is not hard to level up to Max level. 

3 This game has loads of content you start the game off with 5 different characters and if you get the golden ticket later in the game you can unlock multiple reskins of the same characters with different abilities and some look like animals and vampires. But one downside of the character system is that if two people in coop wanted to play Charlie they can't, even if they unlock the reskins. But you at least have 5 choices and not 4. 
   
4 The game has lots of replay value and has a interesting unique mechanic of using your cellphone in game to take pictures of things like barcodes to unlock secrets. The game has many many collectibles and if you are an achievement hunter... Well good luck because s few of them will be a pain to collect all the items like in the "I am thorough" achievement by collecting all the relics, that will be a challenge for you.   

5 The game is not just a typical brawler, it has a few guitar hero sections, it has some interesting puzzles, it has a cellphone camera in game as a way to find secrets, a very interactive environment, it has a place where you can take props throughout the game and if you use a item you can break a table and with that item it will make the broken table drop a prop that you can place in your house you get later in the game to show your friends. The game has many collectibles rare items for example the glitch like a boss relic and the game is great fun to play with your friends.  
 
To Conclude, Charlie murder is an excellent game and is an above average PC port of an xbox live arcade game, it has 4 player local multiplayer a feature welcome on PC, the gameplay is great and the theme is unique, the game has loads of content and some interesting mechanics and lots of replay value, fair challenge and a great game to play with friends locally or online.    

Do I recommend you get this game? Yes, this used to be an xbox exclusive game but now it is out on PC and now you have the chance to try it.

31714011.review:
Video format for those who prefer it (otherwise keep scrolling for the written version):
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bEhtYGXV5kw&t=6m18s

Charlie Murder and The Dishwasher: Vampire Smile were both released on PC on the same day and they're made by the same developer. So I thought I would write something up on the PC ports of both versions. Vampire Smile version linked at the end.

Getting into the gameplay briefly; Charlie Murder is THE Beat'em Up you don't want to skip on. Many people call Beat'Em Ups an inherently repetitive game genre and they aren't wrong. But games that are by nature repetitive can still be fun and Charlie Murder goes above and beyond to shake up the genre a by pacing itself better than other games through stage and enemy variety as well as a crafting system and ways to get equipment that effect your stats and the option to learn new special movies.

Onto the port!
Charlie Murder and Vampire Smile are very identical in terms of the PC port so what I say here is comparable to Vampire Smile. Charlie Murder has a ton of resolution options, some of which go beyond 1080p. The game also supports borderless windowed, fullscreen and windowed mode in addition to having seperate volume sliders for sound effects and music. The game was original an Xbox 360 Arcade title when it was released back in the summer of 2013 so it's not really a graphical powerhouse. The dirty, muddy art style actually holds up really nicely as it doesn't bring down the fact that this was once an Xbox 360 title. As a result there aren't any graphics options but the game doesn't need it. This will run on almost anything.

You also have options to rebind your keyboard and mouse controls. However, some of the defaults aren't exactly ideal and what's worse is that the mechanic involving controling your phone with an analog stick over on 360 has translated to using digital inputs on your keyboard rather than your mouse here. There are also segments that require cursor aim (and you still can't use the mouse) so it's best to switch to a pad all together which is a shame because the keyboard and mouse (while not having a cursor) controls while brawling is actually a lot of fun. Once again you do have the option to rebind all of them and having the mouse and keyboard use the same actions is pretty cool but it is finicky when first booting it up as there aren't a lot of good indications for KB&M prompts.

There is also an issue if you want to record gameplay with Radeon Relive (AMD's Capture Software). The game refused to be recorded if you start in fullscreen mode and if you change back to fullscreen accidently the software will bug out and break. The multiplayer also doesn't have any kind of lobby/server system to find games.

Overall it's a pretty good port but you're better off getting Vampire Smile if you don't have a gamepad. The game is very accessible and it's a lot more enjoyable to me than games like Castle Crashers or Scott Pilgrim but it does have its issues. However, 9.99 is a great deal if you have a gamepad and want to try out a fun, unique, sidescrolling brawler. Even better with friends.

You can check out more info on Vampire Smile here (written):
http://steamcommunity.com/id/76561198009283722/recommended/268990
Or check out the link above at the beginning of the video.

Thanks for reading.
